\subsection{Unlock}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:unlock}}
\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
In version 4.0 or later, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{App.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_30535}{UnlockEx} instead.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

Unlocks the Acrobat application if it was previously locked. This method clears a flag that indicates the viewer is locked. If you called \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{App.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_19732}{Lock} , you should call \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{App.Unlock}} when you are done using OLE automation.

Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{App.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_19732}{Lock} and App \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_30535}{UnlockEx} if you call \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_40575}{OpenInWindow} .

Typically, you call \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{App.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_19732}{Lock} when your application initializes and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{App.Unlock}} in your application’s destructor method.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{Unlock}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}} if successful, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} if not.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:related-methods-26}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Related methods}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{App.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_19732}{Lock}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{App.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_30535}{UnlockEx}

\end{itemize}




\subsection{UnlockEx}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:unlockex}}
Unlocks the Acrobat application if it was previously locked.

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\section{AcroExch.AVDoc}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:acroexch-avdoc}}
A view of a PDF document in a window. This is a creatable interface. There is one \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} object per displayed document. Unlike a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc}} object, an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} object has a window associated with it.

\subsection{Close}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:close}}
Closes a document. You can close all open \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} objects by calling \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{App.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_33231}{CloseAllDocs} .

To reuse an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} object, close it with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_10907}{Close} , then use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} object’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LPDISPATCH}} for \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_40575}{OpenInWindow} .

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{Close}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bNoSave}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:parameters-19}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:section-22}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
bNoSave
&
If a positive number, the document is closed without saving it. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} and the document has been modified, the user is asked whether or not the file should be saved.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

Always returns \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}}, even if no document is open.

\subsection{FindText}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:findtext}}
Finds the specified text, scrolls so that it is visible, and highlights it.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{FindText}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{BSTR} \PYG{n}{szText}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bCaseSensitive}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bWholeWordsOnly}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bReset}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:parameters-20}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:section-23}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
szText
&
The text to be found.
\\
\hline
bCaseSensitive
&
If a positive number, the search is case\sphinxhyphen{}sensitive. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, it is case\sphinxhyphen{}insensitive.
\\
\hline
bWholeWordsOnly
&
If a positive number, the search matches only whole words. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, it matches partial words.
\\
\hline
bReset
&
If a positive number, the search begins on the first page of the document. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, it begins on the current page.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}} if the text was found, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} otherwise.

\subsection{GetViewMode}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:getviewmode}}
Gets the current document view mode (pages only, pages and thumbnails, or pages and bookmarks).

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{GetViewMode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

The current document view mode or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} if no document is open. The return value is one of the following:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDontCare}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}: leave the view mode as it is

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDUseNone}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{1}}: display without bookmarks or thumbnails

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDUseThumbs}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{2}}: display using thumbnails

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDUseBookmarks}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{3}}: display using bookmarks

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDFullScreen}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{4}}: display in full screen mode

\end{itemize}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:related-methods-34}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Related methods}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_35375}{GetAVPageView}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_37022}{SetViewMode}

\end{itemize}




\subsection{IsValid}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:isvalid}}
Determines whether the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AcroExch.AVDoc}} is still valid. This method only checks if the document has been closed or deleted; it does not check the internal structure of the document.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{IsValid}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}} if the document can still be used, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} otherwise.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:related-methods-35}}

\subsection{Open}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:open}}
Opens a file. A new instance of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AcroExch.AVDoc}} must be created for each displayed PDF file.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
An application must explicitly close any \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} that it opens by calling \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_10907}{Close} (the destructor for the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AcroExch.AVDoc}} class does not call \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_10907}{Close}).
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsection{OpenInWindowEx}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:openinwindowex}}
Opens a PDF file and displays it in a user\sphinxhyphen{}specified window. The default Windows file system is used to open the file.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Acrobat uses only its built\sphinxhyphen{}in implementation of the file opening code—not any replacement file system version that a developer might have added with a plug\sphinxhyphen{}in.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

An application must explicitly close any \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} that it opens by calling \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_10907}{Close} (the destructor for the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AcroExch.AVDoc}} class does not call \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_10907}{Close} ).

Do not set the view mode to \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_10907}{Close} with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_37022}{SetViewMode} when using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_22014}{OpenInWindowEx} ; this will cause the viewer and application to hang.

If you use a view mode of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AV\_PAGE\_VIEW}}, the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pagemode}} parameter will be ignored.

See \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVApp.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_19732}{Lock} for a discussion of whether to lock the viewer before making this call.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{OpenInWindowEx}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{LPCTSTR} \PYG{n}{szFullPath}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{hWnd}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{openFlags}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{useOpenParams}

                 \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{pgNum}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{short} \PYG{n}{pageMode}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{short} \PYG{n}{zoomType}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{zoom}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{short} \PYG{n}{top}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{short} \PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:parameters-24}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:section-27}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
szFullPath
&
The full path of the file to open.
\\
\hline
hWnd
&
Handle for the window in which the file is displayed.
\\
\hline
openFlags
&
Type of window view. Must be one of the following:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AV\_EXTERNAL\_VIEW}}: Display the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVPageView}}, scrollbars, toolbar, and bookmark or thumbnails pane. Annotations are active.   \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AV\_DOC\_VIEW}}: Display the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVPageView}}, scrollbars, and bookmark or thumbnails pane. Annotations are active.   \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AV\_PAGE\_VIEW}}: Display only the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVPageView}} (the window that displays the PDF file). Do not display scrollbars, the toolbar, and bookmark or thumbnails pane. Annotations are active.  \sphinxhyphen{}  Use either \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AV\_DOC\_VIEW}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AV\_PAGE\_VIEW}} whenever possible. Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AV\_EXTERNAL\_VIEW}} only if you do not want the application to display its own toolbar. Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AV\_PAGE\_VIEW}} to open the file with no scrollbars and no status window at the bottom of the page.
\\
\hline
useOpenParams
&
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} indicates that the open action of the file is used; a positive number indicates that the action is overridden with the parameters that follow.
\\
\hline
pgNum
&
Page number at which the file is to be opened if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{useOpenParams}} is a positive number. The first page is zero.
\\
\hline
pageMode
&
Specifies page view mode if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{useOpenParams}} is a positive number. Possible values:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDontCare}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}: leave the view mode as it is  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDUseNone}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{1}}: display without bookmarks or thumbnails  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDUseThumbs}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{2}}: display using thumbnails  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDUseBookmarks}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{3}}: display using bookmarks  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDFullScreen}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{4}}: display in full screen mode
\\
\hline
zoomType
&
Zoom type of the page view if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{useOpenParams}} is a positive number. Possible values are:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitHeight}}: Fits the page’s height in the window.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitPage}}: Fits the page in the window.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitVisibleWidth}}: Fits the page’s visible content into the window.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitWidth}}: Fits the page’s width into the window.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomNoVary}}: A fixed zoom, such as 100\%.
\\
\hline
zoom
&
Zoom factor, used only for \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomNoVary}} if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{useOpenParams}} is a positive number.
\\
\hline
top
&
Used for certain zoom types (such as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomNoVary}}) if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{useOpenParams}} is a positive number. See the \sphinxhref{https://www.adobe.com/go/pdfreference}{PDF Reference} for information on views.
\\
\hline
left
&
Used for certain zoom types (such as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomNoVary}}) if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{useOpenParams}} is a positive number. See the \sphinxhref{https://www.adobe.com/go/pdfreference}{PDF Reference} for information on views.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}} if the document was opened successfully, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} otherwise.

\subsection{PrintPages}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:printpages}}
Prints a specified range of pages displaying a print progress dialog box. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PrintPages}} always uses the default printer setting. It is possible to create custom dialog boxes as shown in the ActiveViewVB sample. Such custom dialog boxes could be used in place of the print progress dialog box or any other dialog box.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{PrintPages}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{nFirstPage}\PYG{p}{,}
                 \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{nLastPage}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{nPSLevel}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bBinaryOk}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bShrinkToFit}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:parameters-25}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:section-28}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
nFirstPage
&
The first page to be printed. The first page in a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc}} object is page \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}.
\\
\hline
nLastPage
&
The last page to be printed.
\\
\hline
nPSLevel
&
Valid values are \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{2}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{3}}. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{2}}, PostScript® Level 2 operators are used. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{3}}, PostScript Language Level 3 operators are also used.
\\
\hline
bBinaryOk
&
If a positive number, binary data can be included in the PostScript program. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, all data is encoded as 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit ASCII.
\\
\hline
bShrinkToFit
&
If a positive number, the page is shrunk (if necessary) to fit within the imageable area of the printed page. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, it is not.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} if there were any exceptions while printing or if no document was open, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}} otherwise.

\subsection{PrintPagesEx}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:printpagesex}}
Prints a specified range of pages, displaying a print progress dialog box. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PrintPagesEx}} has more parameters than \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PrintPages}}. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PrintPagesEx}} always uses the default printer setting. It is possible to create custom dialog boxes as shown in the ActiveViewVB sample. Such custom dialog boxes could be used in place of the print progress dialog box or any other dialog box.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{printPagesEx}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{nFirstPage}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{nLastPage}\PYG{p}{,}
                 \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{nPSLevel}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bBinaryOk}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bShrinkToFit}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bReverse}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bFarEastFontOpt}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{bEmitHalftones}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{iPageOption}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:parameters-26}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart

\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
nFirstPage
&
The first page to be printed. The first page in a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc}} object is page \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}.
\\
\hline
nLastPage
&
The last page to be printed.
\\
\hline
nPSLevel
&
If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{2}}, PostScript Level 2 operators are used. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{3}}, PostScript Language Level 3 operators are also used.
\\
\hline
bBinaryOk
&
If a positive number, binary data may be included in the PostScript program. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, all data is encoded as 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit ASCII.
\\
\hline
bShrinkToFit
&
If a positive number, the page is shrunk (if necessary) to fit within the imageable area of the printed page. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, it is not.
\\
\hline
bReverse
&
(PostScript printing only) If a positive number, print the pages in reverse order. If false, print the pages in the regular order.
\\
\hline
bFarEastFontOpt
&
(PostScript printing only) Set to a positive number if the destination printer has multibyte fonts; set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} otherwise.
\\
\hline
bEmitHalftones
&
(PostScript printing only) If a positive number, emit the halftones specified in the document. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, do not.
\\
\hline
iPageOption
&
Pages in the range to print. Must be one of: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDAllPages}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDEvenPagesOnly}}, or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDOddPagesOnly}}.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} if there were any exceptions while printing or if no document was open, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}} otherwise.

\subsection{PrintPagesSilent}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:printpagessilent}}
Prints a specified range of pages without displaying any dialog box. This method is identical to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_30920}{PrintPages} except for not displaying the dialog box. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PrintPagesSilent}} always uses the default printer setting.

\hline
\end{tabular}

\subsection{PrintPagesSilentEx}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:printpagessilentex}}
Prints a specified range of pages without displaying any dialog box. This method is identical to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_37344}{PrintPagesEx} except for not displaying the dialog box. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PrintPagesSilentEx}} has more parameters than \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PrintPagesSilent}}. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PrintPagesSilentEx}} always uses the default printer setting.

&
If a positive number, binary data may be included in the PostScript program. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, all data is encoded as 7\sphinxhyphen{}bit ASCII.
\\
\hline
bShrinkToFit
&
If a positive number, the page is shrunk (if necessary) to fit within the imageable area of the printed page. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, it is not.
\\
\hline
bReverse
&
(PostScript printing only) If a positive number, print the pages in reverse order. If false, print the pages in the regular order.
\\
\hline
bFarEastFontOpt
&
(PostScript printing only) Set to a positive number if the destination printer has multibyte fonts; set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} otherwise.
\\
\hline
bEmitHalftones
&
(PostScript printing only) If a positive number, emit the halftones specified in the document. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, do not.
\\
\hline
iPageOption
&
Pages in the range to print. Must be one of: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDAllPages}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDEvenPagesOnly}}, or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDOddPagesOnly}}.
\\

\subsection{SetTextSelection}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:settextselection}}
Sets the document’s selection to the specified text selection. Before calling this method, use one of the following to create the text selection:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_34819}{CreateTextSelect} : Creates from a rectangle.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDPage.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_37822}{CreatePageHilite} : Creates from a list of character offsets and counts.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDPage.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_14477}{CreateWordHilite} : Creates from a list of word offsets and counts.

\end{itemize}

After calling this method, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_27147}{ShowTextSelect} to show the selection.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{SetTextSelection}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{LPDISPATCH} \PYG{n}{iAcroPDTextSelect}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}

\section{AcroExch.AVPageView}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:acroexch-avpageview}}
The area of the Acrobat application’s window that displays the contents of a document’s page. This is a non\sphinxhyphen{}creatable interface. Every \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} object has an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVPageView}} object and vice versa. The object provides access to the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDPage}} objects for the document being displayed.


\subsection{Methods}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:methods-2}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:id5}}

\subsection{GetZoomType}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:getzoomtype}}

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

Zoom type. The value is one of the following:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitHeight}}: Fits the page’s height in the window.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitPage}}: Fits the page in the window.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitVisibleWidth}}: Fits the page’s visible content into the window.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitWidth}}: Fits the page’s width into the window.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomNoVary}}: A fixed zoom, such as 100\%.

\end{itemize}

\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:zoomto}}

&\sphinxstyletheadfamily

nType
&
Zoom type. Possible values are:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitHeight}}: Fits the page’s height into the window.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitPage}}: Fits the page into the window.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitVisibleWidth}}: Fits the page’s visible content into the window.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitWidth}}: Fits the page’s width into the window.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomNoVary}}: A fixed zoom, such as 100\%.

&

\section{AcroExch.HiliteList}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:acroexch-hilitelist}}
A highlighted region of text in a PDF document, which may include one or more contiguous groups of characters or words on a single page. This is a creatable interface. This object has a single method, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Add}}, and is used by the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDPage}} object to create \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDTextSelect}} objects.




\subsection{Add}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:add}}
Adds the highlight specified by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{nOffset}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{nLength}} to the current highlight list. Highlight lists are used to highlight one or more contiguous groups of characters or words on a single page.

Highlight lists are used both for character\sphinxhyphen{}based and word\sphinxhyphen{}based highlighting, although a single highlight list cannot contain a mixture of character and word highlights. After creating a highlight list, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDPage.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_37822}{CreatePageHilite} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDPage.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_14477}{CreateWordHilite} (depending on whether the highlight list is used for characters or words) to create a text selection from the highlight list.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{Add}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{short} \PYG{n}{nOffset}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{short} \PYG{n}{nLength}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:parameters-38}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:section-42}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
nOffset
&
Offset of the first word or character to be highlighted, the first of which has an offset of zero.
\\
\hline
nLength
&
The number of consecutive words or characters to be highlighted.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

Always returns \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}}.

\item {}

\section{AcroExch.PDAnnot}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:acroexch-pdannot}}
An annotation on a page in a PDF file. This is a non\sphinxhyphen{}creatable interface. Acrobat applications have two built\sphinxhyphen{}in annotation types: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDTextAnnot}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDLinkAnnot}}. The object provides access to the physical attributes of the annotation. Plugins may add movie and Widget (form field) annotations, and developers can define new annotation subtypes by creating new annotation handlers.


\subsection{Methods}

\subsection{GetColor}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:getcolor}}
Gets an annotation’s color.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{GetColor}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

The annotation’s color, a long value of the form 0x00BBGGRR where the first byte from the right (RR) is a relative value for red, the second byte (GG) is a relative value for green, and the third byte (BB) is a relative value for blue. The high\sphinxhyphen{}order byte must be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:related-methods-66}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Related methods}
\begin{itemize}
\item {}

\end{itemize}

&
The color to use for the annotation.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}} if the annotation’s color was set, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} if the Acrobat application does not support editing.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{nRGBColor}} is a long value with the form 0x00BBGGRR where the first byte from the right (RR) is a relative value for red, the second byte (GG) is a relative value for green, and the third byte (BB) is a relative value for blue. The high\sphinxhyphen{}order byte must be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}.

\section{AcroExch.PDBookmark}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:acroexch-pdbookmark}}
A bookmark for a page in a PDF file. This is a creatable interface. Each bookmark has a title that appears on screen, and an action that specifies what happens when a user clicks on the bookmark.

Bookmarks can either be created interactively by the user through the Acrobat application’s user interface or programmatically generated. The typical action for a user\sphinxhyphen{}created bookmark is to move to another location in the current document, although any action can be specified. It is not possible to create a bookmark with OLE—only to destroy one.


\subsection{Methods}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:methods-4}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:id11}}

\subsection{GetByTitle}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:getbytitle}}
Gets the bookmark that has the specified title. The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AcroExch.PDBookmark}} object is set to the specified bookmark as a side effect of the method; it is not the method’s return value. You cannot enumerate bookmark titles with this method.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\section{AcroExch.PDDoc}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:acroexch-pddoc}}
The underlying PDF representation of a document. This is a creatable interface. There is a correspondence between a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc}} object and an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ASFile}} object (an opaque representation of an open file made available through an interface encapsulating Acrobat’s access to file services), and the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc}} object is the hidden object behind every \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} object. An \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ASFile}} object may have zero or more underlying files, so a PDF file does not always correspond to a single disk file. For example, an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ASFile}} object may provide access to PDF data in a database.

Through \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc}} objects, your application can perform most of the Document menu items from Acrobat (delete pages, replace pages, and so on), create and delete thumbnails, and set and retrieve document information fields.


\subsection{Methods}

\subsection{ClearFlags}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:clearflags}}
Clears a document’s flags. The flags indicate whether the document has been modified, whether the document is a temporary document and should be deleted when closed, and the version of PDF used in the file. This method can be used only to clear, not to set, the flag bits.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{ClearFlags}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{nFlags}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:parameters-51}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}

nFlags
&
Flags to be cleared. See \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_24732}{GetFlags} for a description of the flags. The flags \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_17887}{PDDocWasRepaired} , \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_41659}{PDDocNewMajorVersion} , \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_16605}{PDDocNewMinorVersion} , and \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_19653}{PDDocOldVersion} are read\sphinxhyphen{}only and cannot be cleared.

\subsection{Close}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:close-1}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:id17}}
Closes a file.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} are constructed with the same file, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc.Close}} destroys both objects (which closes the document in the viewer).
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\subsection{CreateTextSelect}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:createtextselect}}
Creates a text selection from the specified rectangle on the specified page. After creating the text selection, use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_34749}{SetTextSelection} method to use it as the document’s selection, and use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_27147}{ShowTextSelect} to show the selection.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\subsection{CropPages}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:croppages}}
Crops the pages in a specified range in a document. This method ignores the request if either the width or height of the crop box is less than 72 points (one inch).

nEvenOrOddPagesOnly
&
Value indicating which pages in the range are cropped. Must be one of the following:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}: crop all pages in the range  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{1}}: crop only odd pages in the range  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{2}}: crop only even pages in the range
\\
\hline
iAcroRect
&
An \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LPDISPATCH}} for a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CAcroRect}} specifying the cropping rectangle, which is specified in user space.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}} if the pages were cropped successfully, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} otherwise.

\subsection{GetFlags}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:getflags}}
Gets a document’s flags. The flags indicate whether the document has been modified, whether the document is a temporary document and should be deleted when closed, and the version of PDF used in the file.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{GetFlags}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

The document’s flags, containing an OR of the following:


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:section-64}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Flag
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
PDDocNeedsSave
&
Document has been modified and needs to be saved.
\\
\hline
PDDocRequiresFullSave
&
Document cannot be saved incrementally; it must be written using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveFull}}.
\\
\hline
PDDocIsModified
&
Document has been modified slightly (such as bookmarks or text annotations have been opened or closed), but not in a way that warrants saving.
\\
\hline
PDDocDeleteOnClose
&
Document is based on a temporary file that must be deleted when the document is closed or saved.
\\
\hline
PDDocWasRepaired
&
Document was repaired when it was opened.
\\
\hline
PDDocNewMajorVersion
&
Document’s major version is newer than current.
\\
\hline
PDDocNewMinorVersion
&
Document’s minor version is newer than current.
\\
\hline
PDDocOldVersion
&
Document’s version is older than current.
\\
\hline
PDDocSuppressErrors
&
Don’t display errors.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:related-methods-97}}

The current page mode. Will be one of the following values:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDontCare}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}: leave the view mode as it is

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDUseNone}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{1}}: display without bookmarks or thumbnails

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDUseThumbs}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{2}}: display using thumbnails

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDUseBookmarks}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{3}}: display using bookmarks

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDFullScreen}}: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{4}}: display in full screen mode

\end{itemize}

\subsection{ReplacePages}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:replacepages}}
Replaces the indicated pages in the current document with those specified from the source document. No links or bookmarks are copied from \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{iPDDocSource}}, but text annotations may optionally be copied.

\subsection{Save}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:save}}
Saves a document.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{Save}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{short} \PYG{n}{nType}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{BSTR} \PYG{n}{szFullPath}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:parameters-63}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:section-71}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
nType
&
Specifies the way in which the file should be saved.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{nType}} is a logical OR of one or more of the following flags:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveIncremental}}: Write changes only, not the complete file. This will always result in a larger file, even if objects have been deleted.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveFull}}: Write the entire file to the filename specified by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{szFullPath}}.   \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveCopy}}: Write a copy of the file into the file specified by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{szFullPath}}, but keep using the old file. This flag can only be specified if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveFull}} is also used.   \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveCollectGarbage}}: Remove unreferenced objects; this often reduces the file size, and its usage is encouraged. This flag can only be specified if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveFull}} is also used.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveLinearized}}: Save the file optimized for the web, providing hint tables. This allows the PDF file to be byte\sphinxhyphen{}served. This flag can only be specified if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveFull}} is also used.  \sphinxhyphen{}  If you save a file optimized for the web using the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveLinearized}} flag, you must follow this sequence:  1. Open the PDF file with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_23963}{Open} .  2. Call \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_28634}{Save} using the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDSaveLinearized}} flag.  3. Call \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_10907}{Close} .  This allows batch optimization of files.
\\
\hline
szFullPath
&
The new path to the file, if any.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}1}} if the document was successfully saved . Returns \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} if it was not or if the Acrobat application does not support editing.

\section{AcroExch.PDPage}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:acroexch-pdpage}}
A single page in the PDF representation of a document. This is a non\sphinxhyphen{}creatable interface. Just as PDF files are partially composed of their pages, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc}} objects are composed of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDPage}} objects. A page contains a series of objects representing the objects drawn on the page (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDGraphic}} objects), a list of resources used in drawing the page, annotations (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDAnnot}} objects), an optional thumbnail image of the page, and the threads used in any articles that occur on the page. The first page in a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDDoc}} object is page 0.


\subsection{Methods}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:methods-6}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:id19}}
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDPage}} object has the following methods.

\subsection{AddNewAnnot}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:addnewannot}}
Creates a new text annotation and adds it to the page.

The newly\sphinxhyphen{}created text annotation is not complete until \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDAnnot.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_22402}{SetContents} has been called to fill in the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/Contents}} key.

                 \PYG{n}{LPDISPATCH} \PYG{n}{iAcroRect}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}

\subsection{CopyToClipboard}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:copytoclipboard}}
Copies a PDF image to the clipboard without requiring an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{hWnd}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{hDC}} from the client. This method is only available on 32\sphinxhyphen{}bit systems.

\subsection{DrawEx}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:drawex}}
Draws page contents into a specified window.

You can use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDPage.}} \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_24289}{CopyToClipboard} to copy page contents to the clipboard without an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{hWnd}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{hDC}} from the client.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{DrawEx}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{window}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{displayContext}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{LPDISPATCH} \PYG{n}{updateRect}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{short} \PYG{n}{xOrigin}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{short} \PYG{n}{yOrigin}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{short} \PYG{n}{zoom}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:parameters-74}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}

Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description

\hline
window
&
Handle for the window (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{HWND}}) into which the page is drawn.
\\
\hline
displayContext
&
This parameter is invalid; do not use it. Assign it a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} value. If it is not assigned \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}}, an exception is thrown.   \sphinxhyphen{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{displayContext}} cannot be reliably used as the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{hDC}} for a printer device. In particular, Visual Basic applications cannot use \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_35894}{DrawEx} to print.
\\
\hline
updateRect
&
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LPDISPATCH}} for an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AcroExch.Rect}} to be drawn with user space coordinates. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{updateRect}} contains the instance variable \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{m\_lpDispatch}}, which contains the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LPDISPATCH}}.   Any objects outside of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{updateRect}} are not drawn. All objects are drawn if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{updateRect}} is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}}.   Use methods in the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CAcroRect}} class to set the size of the rectangle. For example:
\begin{quote}

\begin{sphinxVerbatimintable}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{CAcroRect}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{rect} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{new} \PYG{n}{CAcroRect}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{rect}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{CreateDispatch}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{AcroExch.Rect}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{e}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
   \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{rect}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{Set} \PYG{n}{values} \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{rect} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{n}{increases} \PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{right} \PYG{n}{to} \PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o+ow}{and} \PYG{n}{bottom} \PYG{n}{to} \PYG{n}{top} \PYG{o}{*}\PYG{o}{/}
   \PYG{n}{rect}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{SetLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
   \PYG{n}{rect}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{SetTop}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{400}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
   \PYG{n}{rect}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{SetRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{400}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
   \PYG{n}{rect}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{SetBottom}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;} \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatimintable}
\end{quote}
\\
\hline
xOrigin
&
The x–coordinate of the portion of the page to be drawn.
\\
\hline
yOrigin
&
The y–coordinate of the portion of the page to be drawn.
\\
\hline
zoom
&
Zoom factor at which the page is drawn, specified as a percent. For example, 100 corresponds to a magnification of 1.0.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\subsection{GetAnnotIndex}

\subsection{GetNumAnnots}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:getnumannots}}

Annotations that have associated pop\sphinxhyphen{}up windows, such as a strikeout, count as two annotations. Also note that widget annotations (Acrobat form fields) are included.

\section{AcroExch.PDTextSelect}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:acroexch-pdtextselect}}
A selection of text on a single page that may contain more than one disjointed group of words. This is a non\sphinxhyphen{}creatable interface. A text selection is specified by one or more ranges of text, with each range containing the word numbers of the selected words. Each range specifies a start and end word, where “start” is the number of the first word of a series of selected words and “end” is the number of the next word after the last word in the selection.


\subsection{Methods}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:methods-7}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:id21}}
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDTextSelect}} object has the following methods.

&\sphinxstyletheadfamily

\subsection{GetNumText}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:getnumtext}}
Gets the number of text elements in a text selection. Use this method to determine how many times to call the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDTextSelect}}. \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_24003}{GetText} method to obtain all of a text selection’s text.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
A text element is not necessarily a word. A text element consists of characters of the same font, size and style; therefore, there may be more than one text element in a word.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{GetNumText}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

The number of elements in the text selection.

\subsection{GetText}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:gettext}}
Gets the text from the specified element of a text selection. To obtain all the text within the text selection, use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDTextSelect}}. \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_OLE\_Objects.html\#50532405\_40099}{GetNumText} to determine the number of elements in the text selection, then call this method in a loop to obtain each of the elements.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\section{AxAcroPDFLib.AxAcroPDF}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:axacropdflib-axacropdf}}
An object containing a set of methods that provide access to PDF browser controls. This is a creatable interface. This object makes it possible to load a file, move to various pages within the file, and specify various display and print options.

\subsection{GoBackwardStack}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:gobackwardstack}}
Goes to the previous view on the view stack, if the previous view exists. The previous view may be in a different document.

\subsection{Print}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:print}}
Prints the document according to the options selected in a user dialog box. The options include embedded printing (printing within a bounding rectangle on a given page), as well as interactive printing to a specified printer. This method returns immediately, even if the printing has not completed.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
If security settings do not allow printing, this method is ignored.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{void} \PYG{n}{Print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}

\subsection{PrintAllFit}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:printallfit}}
Prints the entire document without displaying a user dialog box, and the pages are shrunk, if necessary, to fit into the imageable area of a page in the printer. The current printer, page settings, and job settings are used. This method returns immediately, even if the printing has not completed.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
If security settings do not allow printing, this method is ignored.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{void} \PYG{n}{printAllFit}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{VARIANT\PYGZus{}BOOL} \PYG{n}{bOn}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:parameters-81}}

\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
bOn
&
Determines whether to scale the imageable area when printing the document. A value of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} indicates that no scaling should be used, and a positive value indicates that the pages are shrunk, if necessary, to fit into the imageable area of a page in the printer.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

Possible values:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DontCare}}: use the current user preference  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SinglePage}}: use single page mode (as it would have appeared in pre\sphinxhyphen{}Acrobat 3.0 viewers)   \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{OneColumn}}: use one\sphinxhyphen{}column continuous mode  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{TwoColumnLeft}}: use two\sphinxhyphen{}column continuous mode with the first page on the left  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{TwoColumnRight}}: use two\sphinxhyphen{}column continuous mode with the first page on the right
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\subsection{SetViewScroll}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_OLE_Objects:setviewscroll}}
Sets the view of a page according to the specified string. Depending on the view mode, the page is either scrolled to the right or scrolled down by the amount specified in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{offset}}.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\chapter{DDE Messages}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:dde-messages}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages::doc}}
This chapter lists all DDE messages supported by Acrobat.

These DDE messages handle the display of the Acrobat application:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_21507}{AppExit}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_40535}{AppHide}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_36588}{AppShow}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_21798}{CloseAllDocs}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_41722}{HideToolbar}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_30748}{MenuitemExecute}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_23287}{ShowToolbar}

\end{itemize}

These DDE messages control the display of the document:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_35723}{DocClose}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_17772}{DocDeletePages}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_24045}{DocInsertPages}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_31954}{DocOpen}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_32593}{DocReplacePages}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_35684}{DocSave}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_11107}{DocSaveAs}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_33767}{DocSetViewMode}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_13590}{FileOpen}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_17462}{FileOpenEx}

\end{itemize}

These DDE messages handle printing of a document:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_14556}{DocPrint}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_41414}{FilePrint}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_28199}{FilePrintEx}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_15288}{FilePrintSilent}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_29945}{FilePrintSilentEx}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_20716}{FilePrintTo}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_42695}{FilePrintToEx}

\end{itemize}

These DDE messages control the view of a document.:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_55018}{DocGoTo}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_79623}{DocGoToNameDest}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_28808}{DocPageDown}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_40373}{DocPageLeft}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_14904}{DocPageRight}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_16952}{DocPageUp}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_33970}{DocScrollTo}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_97206}{DocZoomTo}

\end{itemize}

This DDE message is used for searching:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_77617}{DocFind}

\end{itemize}

Acrobat Reader supports the following subset of DDE messages:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_21507}{AppExit}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_21798}{CloseAllDocs}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_35723}{DocClose}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_55018}{DocGoTo}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_79623}{DocGoToNameDest}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_31954}{DocOpen}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_13590}{FileOpen}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_17462}{FileOpenEx}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_41414}{FilePrint}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_28199}{FilePrintEx}

\item {}

\section{DocFind}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:id20}}
Finds a string in a specified file. This does not use a cross\sphinxhyphen{}document search, but instead performs a page\sphinxhyphen{}by\sphinxhyphen{}page search of the specified file.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{DocFind}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{char}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{fullPath}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{char}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{string}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{boolean} \PYG{n}{caseSensitive}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{boolean} \PYG{n}{wholeWords}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{boolean} \PYG{n}{bReset}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:parameters-2}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:section-2}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
fullPath
&
The full path of the file to be searched.
\\
\hline
string
&
The string to be found.
\\
\hline
caseSensitive
&
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} if the search is case\sphinxhyphen{}sensitive, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} otherwise.
\\
\hline
wholeWords
&
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} if the search will only match whole words, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} otherwise.
\\
\hline
bReset
&
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} if the search begins on the first page of the document, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} if the search begins on the current page.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} if the document specified by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fullPath}} does not exist or if the text is not found, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} otherwise.

\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:parameters-17}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:section-17}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
fullPath
&
The full path of the file whose zoom to set.
\\
\hline
zoomType
&
The zoom strategy to use. Must be one of the following:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomNoVary}}: A fixed zoom, such as 100\%.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitPage}}: Fits the page in the window.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitWidth}}: Fits the page’s width into the window.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomFitVisibleWidth}}: Fits the page’s visible content into the window.
\\
\hline
scale
&
The magnification specified as a percent (for example, 100 corresponds to a magnification of 1.0). \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{scale}} is used only when \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{zoomType}} is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVZoomNoVary}}.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} if the document specified by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fullPath}} does not exist, or if \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{zoomType}} has an unknown value. Returns \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} otherwise.

\section{FileOpenEx}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:id37}}
Opens and displays a file. If the file is already open, it becomes the active document and appears in the front. This DDE message does not add the document to the list that can be manipulated using DDE messages; use \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_DDE\_Messages.html\#50532407\_31954}{DocOpen} to do that.

This method allows documents that either take a long time to open or are password\sphinxhyphen{}protected to open without stopping the flow of DDE messages. Documents opened with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FileOpenEx}} are opened during an idle period. This is useful in situations in which several DDE messages are sent at once, such as a multiple file select from Windows Explorer.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FileOpenEx}} is also supported in Acrobat Reader.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{FileOpenEx}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{char}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{fullPath}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:parameters-19}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:section-19}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
fullPath
&
The full path of the file to be opened.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} is always returned. The specified file may not actually open.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:related-methods-19}}

\section{FilePrintEx}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:id39}}
Prints all pages in a document, displaying a modal print dialog box to the user. For PostScript printing, only Level 1 operators are used, only ASCII data is generated, and the document’s pages are not shrunk to fit into the imageable area of the printed page.

Similar to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FileOpenEx}}, this is a special DDE command that returns \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} right away and performs the action during idle periods. This ensures that no DDE commands are lost when printing a large number of files simultaneously.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FilePrintEx}} is also supported in Acrobat Reader.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{FilePrintEx}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{char}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{fullPath}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
fullPath
&
The full path of the file to print.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} is always returned.

\section{FilePrintSilentEx}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:id41}}
Prints all pages in a document, without displaying a print dialog box to the user. For PostScript printing, only Level 1 operators are used, only ASCII data is generated, and the document’s pages are not shrunk to fit into the imageable area of the printed page.

Similar to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FileOpenEx}}, this is a DDE command that returns \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} right away and does the action during idle periods. This is to ensure that no DDE commands are lost when printing a large number of files simultaneously.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FilePrintSilentEx}} is also supported in Acrobat Reader.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{FilePrintSilentEx}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{char}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{fullPath}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:parameters-23}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:section-23}}\nobreak

\sphinxstyletheadfamily

&\sphinxstyletheadfamily

&
The full path of the file to be printed.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} is always returned.

\section{FilePrintTo}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:id42}}
Prints all pages in a document to a specified printer, using a specified driver and port, displaying a modal print dialog box to the user. For PostScript printing, only ASCII data is generated, and the document’s pages are not shrunk to fit into the imageable area of the printed page.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FilePrintTo}} is also supported in Acrobat Reader.

\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{FilePrintTo}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{char}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{fullPath}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{char}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{printName}\PYG{p}{,}

                 \PYG{n}{char}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{driverName}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{char}\PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n}{portName}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Similar to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FileOpenEx}}, this is a DDE command that returns \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} right away and does the action during idle periods. This is to ensure that no DDE commands are lost when printing a large number of files simultaneously.

\section{FullMenus}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_DDE_Messages:fullmenus}}
Displays full menus, and sets this option in the Acrobat application’s preferences file.

With Acrobat 3.0 or later, all menus are displayed, and this function is ignored.

\chapter{Apple Event Objects and Apple Events}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:apple-event-objects-and-apple-events}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects::doc}}
This chapter describes the supported Apple event objects, with descriptions of each object’s elements and properties, and the supported Apple events.


\section{Objects}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:objects}}
Acrobat presents the following objects to the Apple event interface:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{annotation}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{application}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bookmark}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{conversion}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{document}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Link Annotation}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{menu}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{menu item}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{page}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDF Window}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Text Annotation}}

\end{itemize}




\subsection{annotation}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:annotation}}
An annotation on a page in a PDF file that corresponds to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDAnnot}}, an internal Acrobat class. This object was formerly known as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDAnnot}}.

Acrobat also has two built\sphinxhyphen{}in annotation objects. For more information, see \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_AppleEvtObjects.html\#50532410\_90412}{Link Annotation} and \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_AppleEvtObjects.html\#50532410\_22569}{Text Annotation}.

\sphinxstylestrong{Plural form}

Annotations

\sphinxstylestrong{Properties}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart

integer

&
constant
&
Link annotations only. Determines how the destination rectangle is fitted to the window when the link is activated. Values are: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Left Top Zoom}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit Page}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit Width}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit Height}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit Rect}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit BBox}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit BB Width}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit BB Height}}

These are described in the \sphinxhref{https://www.adobe.com/go/pdfreference}{PDF Reference} .
\\
\hline

integer {[}r/o{]}

Boolean

subtype

international text {[}r/o{]}

The subtype of the annotation.

zoom factor
&
small real
&
Link annotations only. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fit type}} is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Left Top Zoom}}, this specifies the zoom factor; otherwise it is ignored. Setting this property automatically sets \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fit type}} to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Left Top Zoom}}.
\\

\subsection{bookmark}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:bookmark}}
A bookmark on a page in a PDF file. Corresponds to Acrobat’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDBookmark}} object.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This object was formerly known as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDBookmark}}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:plural-form-1}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Plural form}

Bookmarks

\sphinxstylestrong{Properties}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:section-3}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{10}{100}|\X{80}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Property
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Class
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily

best type
&
type class {[}r/o{]}
&
The best descriptor type.
\\
\hline
class
&
type class {[}r/o{]}
&
The class.
\\
\hline
default type
&
type class {[}r/o{]}
&
The default descriptor type.
\\
\hline
destination page number
&
integer
&
The page number to which the \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_AppleEvtObjects.html\#50532410\_29037}{PDF Window} goes when the bookmark’s action is performed.
\\
\hline
destination rectangle
&
list of small real
&
Boundary rectangle (specified in user space) for the view of the destination when the bookmark’s action is performed. Coordinates are specified in the following order: (left, top, right, bottom).
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Set this only after setting \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fit type}}.

\end{itemize}
\\
\hline
fit type
&
constant
&
Controls how the destination rectangle is fitted to the window when the bookmark’s action is performed. Possible values:

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Left Top Zoom}}: Sets a specified zoom and a specified location on the page.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit Page}}: Sets the zoom factor so that the entire page fits into the window.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit Width}}: Sets the zoom factor so that the width of the page fits into the window.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit Height}}: Sets the zoom factor so that the height of the page fits into the window.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit Rect}}: Sets the zoom factor so that the specified rectangle fits into the window.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit BBox}}: Sets the zoom so that the rectangle enclosing all marks on the page (known as the bounding box) fits into the window.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit BB Width}}: Sets the zoom factor so that the width of the bounding box fits into the window.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fit BB Height}}: Sets the zoom factor so that the height of the bounding box fits into the window.
\\
\hline
index
&
integer {[}r/o{]}
&
The bookmark’s index within the \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_AppleEvtObjects.html\#50532410\_48845}{document} .
\\
\hline
name
&
international text
&
The bookmark’s title.
\\
\hline
zoom factor
&
small real
&
The zoom factor used when \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fit type}} is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Left Top Zoom}} ; ignored otherwise. Setting this property automatically sets \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fit type}} to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Left Top Zoom}}.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\subsection{Link Annotation}

\subsection{PDF Window}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:pdf-window}}
The area of the Acrobat or Acrobat Reader window that displays the contents of a page within the document. Corresponds to the Acrobat internal \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AvPageView}} object. A document that is not visible does not have a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDF Window}}.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This object was formerly known as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVPageView}}.

\subsection{Text Annotation}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:text-annotation}}
A PDF text annotation (note) on a page in a PDF file. Can only be used as the target of a \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_AppleEvtObjects.html\#50532410\_24328}{make} event. All other access is via the \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_AppleEvtObjects.html\#50532410\_25583}{annotation} class.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This object was formerly known as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{TextAnnot}}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\sphinxstylestrong{Properties}

Inherits from \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_AppleEvtObjects.html\#50532410\_25583}{annotation} .

\section{Required suite events}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:required-suite-events}}
The following events are sent by the Finder to all applications:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{open}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{print}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{quit}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{run}}

\end{itemize}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Most of these events have counterparts in the Core suite that have greater functionality. The Required suite is not listed in the AppleScript dictionary, even though it is implemented.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

Acrobat Reader also supports the Required suite events, but no others.

saving
&
Determines whether to save a document that has been modified before quitting. Possible values:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yes}}: Save the document.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{no}}: Do not save the document.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ask}}: Ask the user whether to save the document.  The default value is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ask}}.

\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily

saving
&
Determines whether to save documents that have been modified before quitting. Possible values:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{yes}}: Save the document.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{no}}: Do not save the document.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ask}}: If the documents have been modified, ask the user whether to save them.  The default value is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ask}}.

\subsection{save}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:syntax-11}}

\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:section-26}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
save
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
The document to be saved.
\\
\hline
to
&
The file into which the document is to be saved. This parameter is optional in Acrobat 6.0 and higher. Specifying the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{to}} parameter is equivalent to doing a Save As. You can save a document in one of the supported formats with the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{using}} parameter.
\\
\hline
linearize
&
Determines whether the document should be optimized for the web.
\\
\hline
using
&
The conversion method used to save the document in the desired format. Supported conversions by name are \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_AppleEvtObjects.html\#50532410\_79350}{EPS Conversion} and \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_AppleEvtObjects.html\#50532410\_17521}{PostScript Conversion} . All others can be specified by index using the \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_AppleEvtObjects.html\#50532410\_56571}{conversion} object.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\section{Acrobat application events}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:acrobat-application-events}}
This section describes a number of Acrobat API calls for the Apple event interface that are specific to Acrobat applications. The supported events in this suite are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bring to front}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{clear selection}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{close all docs}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{create thumbs}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{delete pages}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{delete thumbs}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{execute}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{find next note}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{find text}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get info}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{go backward}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{go forward}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{goto}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{goto next}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{goto previous}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{insert pages}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{is toolbutton enabled}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{maximize}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{perform}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{print pages}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{read page down}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{read page up}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{remove toolbutton}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{replace pages}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{scroll}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{select text}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{set info}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{zoom}}

\end{itemize}

Apple encourages the use of an application’s signature as the name of its class for application\sphinxhyphen{}specific Apple events. The string \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CARO}} is the name of the class for Acrobat\sphinxhyphen{}specific Apple events:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}define kAEAcrobatViewerClass \PYGZsq{}CARO\PYGZsq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

AppleScript does not need this information.

&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
get info
&
The document from which to obtain the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Info}} dictionary entry.
\\
\hline
key
&
The case\sphinxhyphen{}sensitive \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Info}} dictionary key whose value is to be obtained. The predefined keys are: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Creator}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Producer}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CreationDate}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Author}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Title}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Subject}}, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Keywords}}. None of these is required in the PDF file.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

A string containing the specified key’s value, or an empty string if the key is not found.

\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:print-pages}}
Prints one or more pages from a document without displaying a modal Print dialog box.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:syntax-31}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

 \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{integer}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{PS} \PYG{n}{Level}
 \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{integer}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{binary} \PYG{n}{output}
 \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{boolean}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{shrink} \PYG{n}{to} \PYG{n}{fit}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:parameters-32}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:section-47}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
print pages
&
The document containing the page or pages to be printed. This keyword and the actual filename must be specified.
\\
\hline
first
&
The first page to be printed. The default value is 1.
\\
\hline
last
&
The last page to print. The default value is the number of the last page in the document.
\\
\hline
PS Level
&
The PostScript language level (1 or 2) to use when printing to a PostScript printer. The default value is 1.
\\
\hline
binary output
&
Determines whether binary output is permitted (used for PostScript printing only). The default value is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}}.
\\
\hline
shrink to fit
&
Determines whether pages should be shrunk to fit paper in printer. The default value is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}}.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\section{Miscellaneous events}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_AppleEvtObjects:miscellaneous-events}}
