\chapter{Acrobat Catalog Plug\sphinxhyphen{}In}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_CatalogCatIntro:acrobat-catalog-plug-in}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_CatalogCatIntro::doc}}
This chapter describes IAC support for the Acrobat Catalog plug\sphinxhyphen{}in, which allows you to create a full\sphinxhyphen{}text index of a set of PDF documents. A full\sphinxhyphen{}text index is a searchable database of all the text in the documents. After building an index, you can use the Acrobat Search command to search the entire library quickly. Searches of full\sphinxhyphen{}text indexes created using Catalog are faster and more convenient than using the Find command.

For more information on Catalog, see the Acrobat Help and the \sphinxstyleemphasis{Acrobat and PDF Library API Reference} .


\section{Catalog Windows messages}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_CatalogCatIntro:catalog-windows-messages}}
Catalog broadcasts a set of Windows messages when certain operations occur. These messages are broadcast whether the operations are initiated from the user interface, HFT methods, or DDE methods.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AcrobatCatalogBuildSuccess}}: On every successful build.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AcrobatCatalogBuildFail}}: On every failed build.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AcrobatCatalogBuildStopped}}: When a build has stopped.

\end{itemize}


\section{Catalog DDE methods}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_CatalogCatIntro:catalog-dde-methods}}
Clients can connect to the Catalog plug\sphinxhyphen{}in through DDE using the service name \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Acrobat}} and the topic name \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Control}}. This section lists the available DDE methods.


\subsection{AppExit}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_CatalogCatIntro:appexit}}

\chapter{Acrobat Forms Plug\sphinxhyphen{}In}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:acrobat-forms-plug-in}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro::doc}}
The Acrobat Forms plug\sphinxhyphen{}in allows a PDF document to act as a form; that is, the Acrobat equivalent of a paper form with fields. This chapter describes the OLE automation methods exported by the Acrobat AcroForm plug\sphinxhyphen{}in.

The Forms plug\sphinxhyphen{}in for Acrobat (versions 4.0 and above) allows users to author form fields. For Acrobat Reader, the Forms plug\sphinxhyphen{}in does not allow form authoring, but allows users to fill in data and print Acrobat forms. The Acrobat Reader Forms plug\sphinxhyphen{}in also does not allow users to save data to the local hard disk. Both Acrobat and Acrobat Reader allow Web designers to send data from the form back to a Web server.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Forms as used here do not refer to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{XObject}} forms as defined in the \sphinxhref{https://www.adobe.com/go/pdfreference}{PDF Reference} .
\end{sphinxadmonition}

For more information on forms, see the Acrobat Help and the \sphinxhref{https://www.adobe.com/go/pdflibrary}{PDF Library documentation} .


\section{Forms plug\sphinxhyphen{}in OLE automation}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:forms-plug-in-ole-automation}}
The Acrobat Forms plug\sphinxhyphen{}in works as an automation server in the Windows environment. Because the automation capabilities have been added to a plug\sphinxhyphen{}in, rather than an executable that can be directly launched, the following steps are necessary to access them from an automation controller. Instantiate the Acrobat application by using the Visual Basic \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CreateObject}} method. For example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{CreateObject}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{AcroExch.App}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

This causes the Acrobat Forms plug\sphinxhyphen{}in to run, at which time it registers its class object with OLE. Instantiate the main exposed object:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{CreateObject}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{AFormAut.App}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Registration in the Windows registry (which is different from the class object registration described above) happens every time Acrobat loads the plug\sphinxhyphen{}in. Therefore, you must run Acrobat at least once with the AForm32.api file in the Plugins folder before its type library can be found for object browsing within the Microsoft Visual Studio environment. This is also necessary in order to allow early binding. Declare the program variables as objects of the corresponding classes in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AFORMAUTLib}}, and not simply as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Object}}.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Neither Acrobat nor the Acrobat Forms plug\sphinxhyphen{}in are thread\sphinxhyphen{}safe, and therefore Acrobat Forms OLE automation uses the single\sphinxhyphen{}threading model.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\sphinxstylestrong{Exceptions}

All methods and properties may return an exception. These may include standard OLE exceptions, such as:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{E\_OUTOFMEMORY}} (0x8007000E)

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{E\_INVALIDARG}} (0x80070057)

\end{itemize}

These exceptions are not specifically listed in the descriptions of the methods and properties that appear in this chapter. Others are Acrobat Forms\sphinxhyphen{}specific, and are listed in the following table.

The actual numeric value of the returned exception is assembled as an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{HRESULT}}, uses the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FACILITY\_ITF}}, and starts with decimal 512 (hex 0x0200), as recommended by Microsoft. For example, the numeric value of the exception \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AutErcNoForm}} is 0x80040201. The important part is the right\sphinxhyphen{}most (0x201), which is the first error in the enumeration below.


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{10}{100}|\X{80}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Exception name
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Numeric value
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
AutErcNoDoc
&
1
&
No document is currently open in the Acrobat application.
\\
\hline
AutErcNotTerminal
&
2
&
This property or method applies to terminal fields or their annotations.
\\
\hline
AutErcNotToThisFieldType
&
3
&
This property or method is not applicable to this type of field.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

arrItems
&
An array of strings, with each element representing an item name.  There is a limit of 64K for string data in a combo or list box control on Windows platforms. For Mac OS systems, the limit is 200 entries for the combo or list box control. Using more than these limits degrades performance and makes the control unusable.
\\
\hline
arrExportVal
&
Optional. An array of strings, the same size as the first parameter, with each element representing an export value.  Some of the elements in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{exportString}} may be empty strings.

\subsection{SetBorderColor}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:setbordercolor}}
Specifies the border color for a field. The border color is used to stroke the field’s rectangle with a line as large as the border width. The new border color is propagated to any child annotations underneath, so the field may be non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal.

A string that specifies the face for which the caption will be used. Valid strings include:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{N}}: Normal appearance  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{D}}: Down appearance  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{R}}: Appearance for rollover
\\
\hline
bstrCaption
&
The caption for the button.  If a button’s layout is of type \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{icon}} only, the caption is not used in generating its appearance. In addition, only the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Normal}} face is displayed, unless the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Highlight}} is of type \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{push}}.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\subsection{SetExportValues}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:setexportvalues}}
Sets the export values for each of the annotations of a field of type radio button and checkbox.

For radio button fields, this is necessary to make the field work properly as a group. One button is checked at any given time, giving its value to the field as a whole.

For checkbox fields, unless an export value is specified, the default is used when the field checked is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Yes}}. When it is unchecked, its value is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Off}} (this is also true for a radio button field when none of its buttons are checked).

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-5}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsection{SetForegroundColor}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:setforegroundcolor}}
Specifies the foreground color for a field. It represents the text color for text, button, combobox, or listbox fields and the check color for checkbox or radio button fields.

The parameters are similar to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SetBorderColor}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SetBackgroundColor}}, except that the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{transparent}} color space is not allowed.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-6}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Values are defined by using a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{transparent}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gray}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{RGB}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CMYK}} color space. Valid strings include:   \sphinxhyphen{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{T}} \sphinxhyphen{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{G}} \sphinxhyphen{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{RGB}} \sphinxhyphen{}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CMYK}}

\subsection{SetJavaScriptAction}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:setjavascriptaction}}
Sets the action of the field to be of type \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{JavaScript}}. When using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SetJavaScriptAction}} within Visual Basic, you can use Chr(13) to add a <CR>, and Chr(9) for tabs, so that the function is well formatted.

\sphinxstylestrong{Formatting scripts}

The following scripts and formats can be used for the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{format}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{keystroke}} triggers:


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:section-9}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
AFDate\_KeystrokeEx(cFormat)AFDate\_Format(cFormat)
&
cFormat is one of:  “m/d”, “m/d/yy”, “mm/dd/yy”, “mm/yy”, “d\sphinxhyphen{}mmm”, “d\sphinxhyphen{}mmm\sphinxhyphen{}yy”, “dd\sphinxhyphen{}mmm\sphinxhyphen{}yy”, “yy\sphinxhyphen{}mm\sphinxhyphen{}dd”, “mmm\sphinxhyphen{}yy”, “mmmm\sphinxhyphen{}yy”, “mmm d, yyyy”, “mmmm d, yyyy”, “m/d/yy h:MM tt”, “m/d/yy HH:MM”
\\
\hline
AFTime\_Keystroke(ptf)AFTime\_Format(ptf)
&
ptf is the time format:  0 = 24HR\_MM {[} 14:30 {]}  1 = 12HR\_MM {[} 2:30 PM {]}  2 = 24HR\_MM\_SS {[} 14:30:15 {]}  3 = 12HR\_MM\_SS {[} 2:30:15 PM {]}
\\
\hline
AFPercent\_Keystroke(nDec,sepStyle)AFPercent\_Format(nDec,sepStyle)
&
nDec is the number of places after the decimal point.  sepStyle is an integer denoting whether to use a separator. If sepStyle is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, use commas. If sepStyle is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{1}}, do not separate.
\\
\hline
AFSpecial\_Keystroke(psf)AFSpecial\_Format(psf)
&
psf is the type of formatting to use:  0 = zip code  1 = zip + 4  2 = phone  3 = SSN
\\
\hline
AFNumber\_Format(nDec,sepStyle,negStyle,currStyle,strCurrency,bCurrencyPrepend)AFNumber\_Keystroke(nDec,sepStyle,negStyle,currStyle,strCurrency,bCurrencyPrepend)
&
nDec is the number of places after the decimal point.  sepStyle is an integer denoting whether to use a separator. If sepStyle is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, use commas. If sepStyle is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{1}}, do not separate.   sepStyle is the formatting used for negative numbers:  0 = MinusBlack  1 = Red  2 = ParensBlack  3 = ParensRed  currStyle is the currency style \sphinxhyphen{} not used.  strCurrency is the currency symbol.  bCurrencyPrepend is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} to prepend the currency symbol; \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} to display on the end of the number.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\subsection{SetResetFormAction}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:setresetformaction}}
Sets the action of the field to be of type \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ResetForm}}.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-8}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{void} \PYG{n}{SetResetFormAction} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{LPCTSTR} \PYG{n}{bstrTrigger}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{long} \PYG{n}{theFlags}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{const} \PYG{n}{VARIANT}\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}} \PYG{n}{arrFields}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:parameters-8}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:section-10}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
bstrTrigger
&
A string that specifies which trigger is used for the action. Valid strings include:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{up}}: Mouse up  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{down}}: Mouse down  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{enter}}: Mouse enter  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{exit}}: Mouse exit
\\
\hline
theFlags
&
When \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Include}}), \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{arrFields}} specifies which fields to include in the reset operation. When non\sphinxhyphen{}zero (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Exclude}}), \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{arrFields}} specifies which fields to exclude from the reset operation.
\\
\hline
arrFields
&
Optional. An array of strings for the fully\sphinxhyphen{}qualified names of the fields. Depending on the value of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{theFlags}}, these fields are included in or excluded from the reset operation.   When the fields are included, the set can include the names of non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal fields, which is a fast and easy way to cause all their children to be included in the action.  When not supplied, all fields are reset.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}




\subsection{SetSubmitFormAction}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:setsubmitformaction}}
Sets the action of the field to be of type \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SubmitForm}}.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-9}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:parameters-9}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:section-11}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
bstrTrigger
&
A string that specifies which trigger is used for the action. Valid strings include:  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{up}}: Mouse up  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{down}}: Mouse down  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{enter}}: Mouse enter  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{exit}}: Mouse exit
\\
\hline
bstrTheURL
&
A string containing the URL.
\\
\hline
theFlags
&
A collection of flags that define various characteristics of the action.  See the \sphinxhref{https://www.adobe.com/go/pdfreference}{PDF Reference} to learn how the binary value of this \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{long}} is interpreted.
\\
\hline
arrFields
&
Optional. If specified, represents an array of strings for the fully\sphinxhyphen{}qualified names of the fields to submit when the action is executed. If the array is interpreted as fields to submit (as opposed to fields excluded from the submission, depending on the least\sphinxhyphen{}significant bit in the flags), then it may include the names of non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal fields, which is a way to cause all their children to be included in the submission.  If not specified, the created action does not include a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/Fields}} key.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

\subsection{Alignment}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:alignment}}
The text alignment of a text field. Valid alignments are:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\PYG{n}{center}
\PYG{n}{right}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

On a set, the property is propagated to any child annotations underneath, so the field may be non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal.

\subsection{BorderWidth}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:borderwidth}}
The thickness of the border when stroking the perimeter of a field’s rectangle. If the border color is transparent, this property has no effect except in the case of a beveled border. The value \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} represents no border, and the value \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{3}} represents a thick border.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-12}}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstylestrong{Returns}

If it is terminal and has multiple child annotations, a get returns the value of the border width for the first child, whichever annotation that happens to be.

On a set, the property is propagated to any child annotations underneath, so the field may be non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:exceptions-7}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Exceptions}

On a get, if the field is non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal, an exception \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_63155}{AutErcNotTerminal} is returned.

\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{ButtonLayout}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:buttonlayout}}
The layout appearance of a button. Valid values include:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}: Text only; the button has a caption but no icon.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{1}}: Icon only; the button has an icon but no caption.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{2}}: Icon over text; the icon should appear on top of the caption.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{3}}: Text over icon; the text should appear on top of the icon.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{4}}: Icon then text; the icon should appear to the left of the caption.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{5}}: Text then icon; the icon should appear to the right of the caption.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{6}}: Text over icon; the text should be overlaid on top of the icon.

\end{itemize}

If it is terminal and has multiple child annotations, a get returns the layout for the first child, whichever annotation that happens to be.

On a set, the property is propagated to any child annotations underneath, therefore the field can be non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-13}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nb}{set}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{short}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:exceptions-8}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Exceptions}

If the field is not of type \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{button}}, an exception \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_95289}{AutErcNotToThisFieldType} is returned.

On a get, if the field is non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal, an exception \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_63155}{AutErcNotTerminal} is returned.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:example-9}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{Field}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{ButtonLayout} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{CalcOrderIndex}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:calcorderindex}}
The zero\sphinxhyphen{}based calculation order of fields in the document. If you want the calculation for a field \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{f2}} to be performed after that for field \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{f1}}, you need only set the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CalcOrderIndex}} for \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{f2}} to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{f1}} ‘s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CalcOrderIndex}} + 1. The elements in the calculation order array are shifted to make room for the insertion, but the first calculation is still at index 0.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-14}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nb}{set}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{short}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:example-10}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{Set} \PYG{n}{F1} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Fields}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{SubTotal}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{Set} \PYG{n}{F2} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Fields}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Total}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{F2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{CalcOrderIndex} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{F1}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{CalcOrderIndex} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsection{IsHidden}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:ishidden}}
Determines whether the field is hidden or visible to the user. If the value is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} the field is invisible, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} indicates that the field is visible.

During get operations, if the field is non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal, an exception \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_63155}{AutErcNotTerminal} is returned. If it is terminal, and has multiple child annotations, a get returns the value of the hidden flag for the first child, whichever annotation that happens to be.

During set operations, the property is propagated to any child annotations underneath, therefore a field can be non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal.

\subsection{IsPassword}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:ispassword}}
Determines whether the field will display asterisks for the data entered. Upon submission, the actual data entered is sent. Fields that have the password attribute set will not have the data in the field saved when the document is saved to disk.

On a set, the property is propagated to any child annotations underneath, if any.

\subsection{IsReadOnly}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:isreadonly}}
The read\sphinxhyphen{}only characteristic of a field. When a field is read\sphinxhyphen{}only, the user can see the field but cannot change it. If a button is read\sphinxhyphen{}only, the user cannot click it to execute an action.

Because this is a field flag and not an annotation flag, both a get and a set of this property are allowed regardless of whether the field is terminal or non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
A get on a non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal field retrieves that field’s flag.

\item {} 
A set changes the flag on all its terminal children.

\end{itemize}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-22}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nb}{set}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{Boolean}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{IsRequired}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:isrequired}}
The required characteristic of a field. When a field is required, its value must be non\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} when the user clicks a submit button that causes the value of the field to be sent to the web. If the field value is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}}, the user receives a warning message and the submit does not occur.

Since this is a field flag and not an annotation flag, both a get and a set of this property are allowed, regardless of whether the field is terminal or non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal.

A get on a non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal field retrieves that field’s flag. A set changes the flag on all its terminal children.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-23}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nb}{set}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{Boolean}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{IsTerminal}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:isterminal}}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} if the field is terminal, otherwise \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}}.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-24}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:example-16}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\PYG{n}{Dim} \PYG{n}{bTerminal} \PYG{n}{As} \PYG{n}{Boolean}

\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{bTerminal should be True}
\PYG{n}{bTerminal} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Field}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{IsTerminal}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{Name}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:name}}
The fully qualified name of the field. It is the default member of the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Field}} interface.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-25}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{NoViewFlag}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:noviewflag}}
Determines whether a given field prints but does not display on the screen.

Set the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NoViewFlag}} property to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} to allow the field to appear when the user prints the document but not when it displays on the screen; set it to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} to allow both printing and displaying.

On a get, if the field is non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal, an exception \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_63155}{AutErcNotTerminal} is returned. If it is terminal, and has multiple child annotations, a get returns the value of the no\sphinxhyphen{}view flag for the first child, whichever annotation that happens to be.

On a set, the property is propagated to any child annotations underneath, so the field may be non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-26}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nb}{set}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{Boolean}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{PrintFlag}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:printflag}}
Determines whether a field prints. Set the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PrintFlag}} property to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} to allow the field to appear when the user prints the document, set it to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} to prevent printing.

On a get, if the field is non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal, an exception \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_63155}{AutErcNotTerminal} is returned. If it is terminal, and has multiple child annotations, a get returns the value of the print flag for the first child, whichever annotation that happens to be.

On a set, the property is propagated to any child annotations underneath, so the field may be non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-27}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nb}{set}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{Boolean}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{Style}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:style}}
The style of a checkbox or a radio button (the glyph used to indicate that the check box or radio button has been selected).

Valid styles include:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{check}
\PYG{n}{cross}
\PYG{n}{diamond}
\PYG{n}{circle}
\PYG{n}{star}
\PYG{n}{square}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

If it is terminal and has multiple child annotations, a get returns the style for the first child, whichever annotation that happens to be.

On a set, the property is propagated to any child annotations underneath, therefore a field can be non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-28}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nb}{set}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{String}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:exceptions-14}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Exceptions}

During set, if the field is not of type checkbox or radio button, an exception \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_95289}{AutErcNotToThisFieldType} is returned.

On a get, if the field is non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal, an exception \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_63155}{AutErcNotTerminal} is returned.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:example-17}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{Field}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Style} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{star}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{TextFont}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:textfont}}
The text font used when laying out the field. Valid fonts include:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{Courier}
\PYG{n}{Courier}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{Bold}
\PYG{n}{Courier}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{Oblique}
\PYG{n}{Courier}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{BoldOblique}
\PYG{n}{Helvetica}
\PYG{n}{Helvetica}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{Bold}
\PYG{n}{Helvetica}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{Oblique}
\PYG{n}{Helvetica}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{BoldOblique}
\PYG{n}{Symbol}
\PYG{n}{Times}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{Roman}
\PYG{n}{Times}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{Bold}
\PYG{n}{Times}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{Italic}
\PYG{n}{Times}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{BoldItalic}
\PYG{n}{ZapfDingbats}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

On a set, the property is propagated to any child annotations underneath, if any.

\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{TextSize}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:textsize}}
The text points size used in the field. In combobox and radio button fields, the text size determines the size of the check. Valid text sizes include zero and the range from 4 to 144 inclusive.

A text size of zero means that the largest point size that can still fit in the field’s rectangle should be used. In multi\sphinxhyphen{}line text fields and buttons this is always 12 points.

On a set, the property is propagated to any child annotations underneath, if any.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-30}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:example-19}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsection{Value}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:value}}
A string that represents the value of the field.  Returns  the empty string if the field has no value. If the field is non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal, an exception \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_63155}{AutErcNotTerminal} is returned.

For fields of type checkbox, the value \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Off}} represents the unchecked state. The checked state is represented using the export value. This is also true for radio buttons (where each individual button in a group should have a different export value; see \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_27660}{SetExportValues}). For fields of type listbox or combobox, if an export value is defined, then that represents the value, otherwise the item name is used.

These remarks apply also to \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_89449}{DefaultValue}.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-32}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nb}{set}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{String}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:example-21}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{Dim} \PYG{n}{arrExp}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{n}{As} \PYG{n}{String}
\PYG{n}{arrExp}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{CreditCardV}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{n}{arrExp}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{CreditCardM}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{n}{Field}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{SetExportValues} \PYG{n}{arrExp}
\PYG{n}{Field}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Value} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{arrExp}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Fields}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:fields}}
A collection of all the fields in the document that are currently active in Acrobat at the time \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fields}} is instantiated.

The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fields}} collection includes both terminal and non\sphinxhyphen{}terminal fields. A terminal field is one that either does not have children, or if it does, they are simply multiple appearances (that is, child annotations) of the field in question.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
If you instantiate a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fields}} object, and subsequently fields are manually added or removed using the Forms tool in Acrobat, the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fields}} object will no longer be in sync with the document. You must re\sphinxhyphen{}instantiate the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fields}} object.
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\subsection{Methods}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:methods-1}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:id1}}
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fields}} object has the following methods.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_43345}{Add}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_52006}{AddDocJavascript}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_54145}{ExecuteThisJavascript}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_13920}{ExportAsFDF}

\item {} 
\sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_FormsIntro.html\#50532406\_68256}{ExportAsHtml}

\item {}

\end{itemize}




\subsection{Add}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:add}}
Dynamically adds a new field to the Acrobat form and to the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fields}} collection.
\begin{quote}

Returns  the newly\sphinxhyphen{}created \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Field}} object. You can pass the name of an existing field as a parameter, as long as that field is of the same type as the one being created.
\end{quote}

This is useful in the following circumstances:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
For radio buttons to use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SetExportValues}} method to make the radio buttons mutually exclusive.

\item {} 
For fields that should have multiple appearances (that is, child annotations) in the document.

\end{itemize}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-33}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsection{AddDocJavascript}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:adddocjavascript}}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\PYG{n}{Dim} \PYG{n}{Field} \PYG{n}{As} \PYG{n}{AFORMAUTLib}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Field}
\PYG{n}{Dim} \PYG{n}{nFields} \PYG{n}{As} \PYG{n}{Long}

\PYG{n}{nFields} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Fields}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Count}

\PYG{n}{For} \PYG{n}{Each} \PYG{n}{Field} \PYG{n}{In} \PYG{n}{Fields}
\PYG{n}{If} \PYG{n}{Field}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{IsTerminal} \PYG{n}{Then}
\PYG{n+nb}{print} \PYG{n}{Field}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Value}
\PYG{n}{End} \PYG{n}{If}
\PYG{n}{Next} \PYG{n}{Field}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{Item}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:item}}
Takes the fully qualified name of the field (for example, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"name.last"}}) as a parameter, and returns the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Field}} object for it. It is the default member of the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Fields}} interface. That is, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{item}} is the property invoked if the object name is specified by itself without a property or a method in the controller script.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-41}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{read}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{only}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{IDispatch}\PYG{o}{*}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:example-28}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{Dim} \PYG{n}{Field} \PYG{n}{As} \PYG{n}{AFORMAUTLib}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Field}
\PYG{n}{Dim} \PYG{n}{nFields} \PYG{n}{As} \PYG{n}{Long}

\PYG{n}{Set} \PYG{n}{Field} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Fields}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Item}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{name.last}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Since Item is the default\PYGZus{} property:}
\PYG{n}{Set} \PYG{n}{Field} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Fields}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{name.last}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\subsection{\_NewEnum}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:newenum}}
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{IEnumVariant}} enumerator for the collection.

You do not need to call this property directly. Visual Basic calls it in the background whenever the code contains a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{For Each Field In Fields}} loop. For example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{For} \PYG{n}{Each} \PYG{n}{Field} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{Fields}
\PYG{n}{If} \PYG{n}{Field}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{IsTerminal}
\PYG{n+nb}{print} \PYG{n}{Field}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Value}
\PYG{n}{End} \PYG{n}{If}
\PYG{n}{Next} \PYG{n}{Field}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_FormsIntro:syntax-42}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Syntax}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{read}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{only}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{n}{IUnknown}\PYG{o}{*}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{Acrobat Search Plug\sphinxhyphen{}in}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:acrobat-search-plug-in}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro::doc}}
This chapter describes IAC support for the Acrobat Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in, which allows users to perform text searches in PDF documents. It adds menus, menu items, toolbar buttons, and a Search panel to the Acrobat application. The Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in exports a host function table (HFT) containing several methods that can be used by other Plugins.

Search supports interapplication communication in the form of DDE messages in Windows and Apple events in Mac OS. These messages and events allow remote clients to submit search queries and manipulate a list of indexes (the list of indexes is referred to as the shelf).

For more information, see the \sphinxhref{https://www.adobe.com/go/pdflibrary}{PDF Library documentation}.




\section{Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in using DDE}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:search-plug-in-using-dde}}
A client can connect to the Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in with DDE using the service name \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"Acrobat Search"}} and the topic name \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"Acrobat Search"}}.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{DdeInitialize}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{DDE\PYGZus{}ProcessMessage}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{APPCMD\PYGZus{}CLIENTONLY}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{hszServerName} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{DdeCreateStringHandle}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Acrobat Search}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{hszTopicName} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{DdeCreateStringHandle}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Acrobat Search}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{hConv} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{DdeConnect}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{hszServerName}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{hszTopicName}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{NULL}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

After a connection has been made, a single poke transaction will submit a search query. Two types of queries are supported: simple query and query.


\subsection{Simple query item}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:simple-query-item}}
A simple query has the item name “\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SimpleQuery"}}. When using a simple query, pass only a string that contains the query, using the ASQL query parser’s format (see \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{QLangType\_CQL}} in the table \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_SearchIntro.html\#50532404\_97440}{Query language type constants}). It is not possible to choose another parser or to set word options using the simple query item.


\subsection{Query item}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:query-item}}
A query has the item name “\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Query}} “. When using query, a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{QueryData}} structure is used. This structure contains the query, as well as specifying the query parser to use and additional options.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hszItemName} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{DdeCreateStringHandle}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Query}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{DdeClientTransaction}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{nLen}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{hConv}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{hszItemName}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{CF\PYGZus{}TEXT}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{XTYP\PYGZus{}POKE}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{1000}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{dwResult}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{DdeDisconnect}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{hConv}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The global data handle (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{qd}}) passed to the server must be in the following format:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{typedef} \PYG{n}{struct} \PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}QueryData} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
     \PYG{n}{eQLangType} \PYG{n}{qlt}\PYG{p}{;}
     \PYG{n}{boolean} \PYG{n}{bOverrideWordOptions}\PYG{p}{;}
     \PYG{n}{uns32} \PYG{n}{nWordOptions}\PYG{p}{;}
     \PYG{n}{uns16} \PYG{n}{nMaxDocs}\PYG{p}{;}
     \PYG{n}{uns16} \PYG{n}{nQueryOffset}\PYG{p}{;}
     \PYG{n}{uns16} \PYG{n}{nNumSorts}\PYG{p}{;} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{deprecated} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{Acrobat} \PYG{l+m+mf}{6.0}
     \PYG{n}{uns16} \PYG{n}{nSortOffset}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{QP\PYGZus{}MAX\PYGZus{}SORT\PYGZus{}FIELDS}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{;} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{deprecated} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{Acrobat} \PYG{l+m+mf}{6.0}
     \PYG{n}{boolean} \PYG{n}{bSortWays}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{QP\PYGZus{}MAX\PYGZus{}SORT\PYGZus{}FIELDS}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{;} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{deprecated} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{Acrobat} \PYG{l+m+mf}{6.0}
     \PYG{n}{unsigned} \PYG{n}{char} \PYG{n}{cData}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{;}
 \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}} \PYG{n}{QueryData}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Query options}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:query-options}}

\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
qlt
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
The query language type. Must be one of the values shown in \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_SearchIntro.html\#50532404\_97440}{Query language type constants}.
\\
\hline
bOverrideWordOptions
&
Indicates that the client wishes to use different word options than those currently set by the user.
\\
\hline
nWordOptions
&
The word options. Must be an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{OR}} of the values shown in \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_SearchIntro.html\#50532404\_78200}{Word option bit\sphinxhyphen{}flag constants}.
\\
\hline
nMaxDocs
&
If non\sphinxhyphen{}zero, the client wishes to use a different limit for the maximum number of documents than the limit currently set by the user.
\\
\hline
nSortOffsets
&
A list of offsets into the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cData}} chunk. Each offset points to a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} \sphinxhyphen{}terminated string containing the field name.  This value has no effect in Acrobat 6.0 or later, because sort options are not valid.
\\
\hline
nQueryOffset
&
An offset into the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cData}} chunk that points to a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} \sphinxhyphen{}terminated string containing the query to execute.
\\
\hline
nNumSorts
&
The number of fields in the sort spec. If this number is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, the plug\sphinxhyphen{}in uses the current sort spec set by the user.   This value has no effect in Acrobat 6.0 or later, because sort options are not valid.
\\
\hline
bSortWays
&
A list of sort order flags, one for each sort field. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{true}} indicates an ascending sort, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{false}} indicates a descending sort.  This value has no effect in Acrobat 6.0 or later, because sort options are not valid.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}




\subsection{Query language type constants}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:query-language-type-constants}}

\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:section-1}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
QLangType\_Simple
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Allows only simple phrase searches; does not allow Boolean searching.  This query type does not work in the DDE interface of the Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in shipped with version 2.0 of Acrobat.
\\
\hline
QLangType\_CQL
&
Allows Boolean searches using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AND}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{OR}}, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NOT}}, as described in the Acrobat Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in’s online help file.
\\
\hline
QLangType\_Passthrough
&
The Verity BooleanPlus query language. Contact Verity for further information on this language.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}




\subsection{Word option bit\sphinxhyphen{}flag constants}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:word-option-bit-flag-constants}}

\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:section-2}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
QPON\_Case
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
The search is case\sphinxhyphen{}sensitive.
\\
\hline
QPON\_Stemming
&
Find not only the specified word, but other words that have the same stem. For example, run and ran have the same stem.
\\
\hline
QPON\_SoundsLike
&
Find not only the specified word, but other words that sound like it.
\\
\hline
QPON\_Thesaurus
&
Find not only the specified word, but other words that have the same meaning.
\\
\hline
QPON\_Proximity
&
Consider the proximity of results when using the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AND}} operator to look for more than one word in a document. Without this option, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AND}} terms can be anywhere in a document. Searching for “red” and “blue,” for example, finds a document where “red” is the first word on the first page and where “blue” is the last word on the last page. With this option, however, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AND}} terms must be within two or three pages of each other to be found. Also, the closer \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AND}} terms appear together, the higher the relevance ranking of the document that contains them.
\\
\hline
QPON\_Refine
&
Do not search the entire list of indexes, but only the documents that matched the previous search. This is used to refine the results of the previous search.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

To create and populate this structure correctly, the client must know the sum of the lengths of each sort field (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sls}}), the length of the query (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lq}}), and the size of the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{QueryData}} structure. The client then allocates memory as follows:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{nSize} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sizeof}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{QueryData}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{sls} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{lq}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{qd} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{QueryData} \PYG{o}{*}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{n}{malloc}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{nSize}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

For example, if the query was “Adobe” and the sort spec was “Title” ascending and “Score” descending then the structure would be packed as follows:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{memset}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{nSize}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{nQueryOffset} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{strcpy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{cData}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Adobe}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{nNumSort} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{nSortOffset}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{strlen}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Adobe}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{bSortWays}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{TRUE}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{strcpy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{cData}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{nSortOffset}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Title}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{bSortWays}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{FALSE}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{nSortOffset}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{nSortOffset}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{strlen}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Title}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{strcpy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{cData}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{nSortOffset}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Score}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Manipulating indexes through DDE}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:manipulating-indexes-through-dde}}
After a connection has been made, a single poke transaction can add, delete, add, or remove indexes. The item name to use is “\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Index".}}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hszItemName} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{DdeCreateStringHandle}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Index}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{DdeClientTransaction}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{qd}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{nLen}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{hConv}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{hszItemName}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{CF\PYGZus{}TEXT}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{XTYP\PYGZus{}POKE}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{1000}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n}{dwResult}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{DdeDisconnect}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{hConv}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The global data handle (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gd}}) passed to the server must be in the following format:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{typedef} \PYG{n}{struct} \PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}IndexData} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
     \PYG{n}{IndexActionType} \PYG{n}{eAction}\PYG{p}{;}
     \PYG{n}{int16} \PYG{n}{nIndexOffset}\PYG{p}{;}
     \PYG{n}{int16} \PYG{n}{nTempNameOffset}\PYG{p}{;}
     \PYG{n}{unsigned} \PYG{n}{char} \PYG{n}{cData}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{;}
 \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}} \PYG{n}{IndexData}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Options}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:options}}

\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:section-3}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
eAction
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
The operation to be performed on the index. Must be one of values listed in \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_SearchIntro.html\#50532404\_25513}{Index operation selectors}.
\\
\hline
nIndexOffset
&
An offset into the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cData}} chunk that points to a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} \sphinxhyphen{}terminated string containing the PDX file representing the index.
\\
\hline
nTempNameOffset
&
An offset into \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cData}}. It points to a temporary name that is displayed by the Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in when the index is unavailable. This field must specify an offset either to an empty string (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}) or to a non\sphinxhyphen{}empty C string.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}




\subsection{Index operation selectors}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:index-operation-selectors}}

\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:section-4}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
IndexAction\_Add
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Adds an index to the shelf.
\\
\hline
IndexAction\_Remove
&
Removes an index from the shelf.
\\
\hline
IndexAction\_Enable
&
Enables an index on the shelf.
\\
\hline
IndexAction\_Disable
&
Disables an index on the shelf.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}

To create and populate this structure correctly, the client must know the sum of the lengths of the Index (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{li}}) and Temp names (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lt}}) (including \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} \sphinxhyphen{}terminating characters), and the size of the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{IndexData}} structure.

The client then allocates memory as follows:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{nSize} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sizeof}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{IndexData}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{li} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{lt}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n+nb}{id} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{IndexData} \PYG{o}{*}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{n}{malloc}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{nSize}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

For example, to add the index C:FOO.PDX to the Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in’s shelf:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{memset}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{nSize}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{eAction} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{IndexAction\PYGZus{}Add}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{nIndexOffset} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{strcpy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{cData}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{C:FOO.PDX}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{nTempNameOffset} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{strlen}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{C:FOO.PDX}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{;}
\PYG{n}{strcpy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}}\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{cData}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb}{id}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{n}{nTempNameOffset}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}

 \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{My Favorite Index}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{;}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}




\section{Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in using Apple events}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:search-plug-in-using-apple-events}}
The Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in supports the Apple events described in this section.




\subsection{SearchAddIndex}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:searchaddindex}}
Adds a specified index to the shelf.

\sphinxstylestrong{Apple event ID}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{kSearchAddIndex} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{addx}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsection{SearchDoQuery}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:searchdoquery}}
Executes a specified query, using the set of indexes currently on the shelf. The search results are displayed in the Acrobat Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in’s Results window.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:apple-event-id-2}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Apple event ID}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{kSearchDoQuery} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{kwry}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:parameters-2}}
\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters}


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:section-7}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Parameters
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
Description
\\
\hline
kQueryStringTag (‘Quryv), typeChar
&
The query string, a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} \sphinxhyphen{}terminated block of text. Its format is the same as what a user would type into the search Query window, and depends on the search language specified by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{kParserTag}}.
\\
\hline
kParserTag (‘Prsr’), typeShortInteger
&
The query parser to use; may be one of (see SrchType.h):  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{kParserSimple 0}}: Allows only simple phrase searches; does not allow Boolean searching.  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{kParserCQL 1}}: Allows Boolean searches using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AND}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{OR}}, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NOT}}, as described in the Acrobat Search plug\sphinxhyphen{}in’s online help file.   \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{kParserBPlus 2}}: The Verity BooleanPlus query language. Contact Verity for further information on this language.
\\
\hline
kSortSpecTag (‘Sort’), typeAEList
&
A list of C strings representing fields to sort by. The first element is the first level sort, the second is the second level sort, and so forth.  Each string may be any field that appears in the index, plus \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Score}} (which sorts results by relevance ranking). Some common fields are Title, ModificationDate, CreationDate, and Keywords.
\\
\hline
kWordOptionsTag (‘WOpt’), typeLongInteger
&
A bit field of word options. Must be a logical OR of the values listed below in \sphinxhref{IAC\_API\_SearchIntro.html\#50532404\_40152}{Word options for Apple events}.  The manner in which the options are used depends on the value associated with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{kOptionsOverrideTag}}.
\\
\hline
kOptionsOverrideTag (‘WOer’), typeShortInteger
&
Flag that indicates whether the word options are \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{OR'ed}} with the search options set in the user interface, or used instead of them. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}, the word options are \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{OR'ed}} with the user interface search options, and the resulting value is used. If non\sphinxhyphen{}zero, the word options are used instead of the user interface search options.
\\
\hline
kMaxDocsTag (‘MaxD’), typeShortInteger
&
The maximum number of documents to display in the Results window. If more documents than this have hits, only the first \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{maxDocs}} are displayed. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{maxDocs}} cannot be greater than 999.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}




\subsection{Word options for Apple events}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:word-options-for-apple-events}}

\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:section-8}}\nobreak
\begin{tabular}[t]{|\X{10}{100}|\X{90}{100}|}
\hline
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
kWordOptionCase
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
The search is case\sphinxhyphen{}sensitive.
\\
\hline
kWordOptionStemming
&
Find not only the specified word, but other words that have the same stem (for example, run and ran have the same stem).
\\
\hline
kWordOptionSoundsLike
&
Find not only the specified word, but other words that sound like it.
\\
\hline
kWordOptionThesaurus
&
Find not only the specified word, but other words that have the same meaning.
\\
\hline
kWordOptionProximity
&
Consider the proximity of results when using the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AND}} operator to look for more than one word in a document. Without \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{kWordOptionProximity}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AND}} terms can be anywhere in a document. Searching for “red” and “blue,” for example, finds a document where “red” is the first word on the first page and where “blue” is the last word on the last page. With \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{kWordOptionProximity}}, however, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AND}} terms must be within two or three pages of each other to be found. Also, with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{kWordOptionProximity}}, the closer \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AND}} terms appear together, the higher the relevance ranking of the document that contains them.
\\
\hline
kWordOptionRefine
&
Do not search the entire list of indexes, but only the documents that matched the previous search. This is used to refine the results of the previous search.
\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\par
\sphinxattableend\end{savenotes}




\subsection{SearchGetIndexByPath}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_SearchIntro:searchgetindexbypath}}
Gets the index that has the specified path. The index must already be on the shelf. The index can be passed to other Search Apple events to remove it from the shelf, obtain its title, and so forth.

\chapter{Coordinate Systems}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_CoordinateSystems:coordinate-systems}}\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_CoordinateSystems::doc}}

\section{User space}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_CoordinateSystems:user-space}}
The user space is the coordinate system used within PDF files. In the IAC interface, it is used for most PD layer objects (that is, objects such as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PDBookmark}} whose names begin with “PD”). The following graphic shows the user space coordinate system. The orientation, origin, and scale of the user space coordinate system can be changed by operators in the page description in a PDF file.

User space coordinate system

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics{{userspace}.png}

The default user space is the user space coordinate system in effect immediately before each page begins drawing. The origin of this coordinate system is the lower left corner of a page’s media box. The x\sphinxhyphen{}coordinate increases to the right, and the y\sphinxhyphen{}coordinate increases upward. One unit in the default user space is 1/72 of an inch.


\section{Device space}
\label{\detokenize{IAC_API_CoordinateSystems:device-space}}
The device space specifies coordinates in screen pixels, as shown in the following graphic. It is used in the AV layer of the IAC interface (that is, objects such as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{AVDoc}} whose names begin with “AV”).

Device space coordinate system

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics{{devicespace}.png}

The origin of the device space coordinate system is at the upper left corner of the visible page on the screen (that is, the upper left corner of the white part of the page). The x\sphinxhyphen{}coordinate increases to the right, and the y\sphinxhyphen{}coordinate increases downward.

The upper left corner of the visible page is determined by the intersection of a page’s PDF crop box and media box. As a result, the device space coordinate system changes if the cropping on a page changes.



\renewcommand{\indexname}{Index}
\printindex
\end{document}
